content: For what it’s worth, To Pimp a Butterfly initially hit me much harder than this. He just nailed the “jazz opus” which, when nailed is my favourite flavour of hip-hop. That being said, the “athletic” rapping here is undeniable. I wouldn’t be surprised if this one is what he ends up looking back on as the album’s he found is voice and everything was firing. Time will tell how I feel about it in the long run, but right now it’s just awesome. Kendrick is untouchable.
